website_summaries.verdict: Fast, efficient, and quiet compressed air that works with your car’s cigarette lighter socket.
pros: Offers working voltage of 12 volts DC and maximum amperage of 15
Display is easy to follow with PSI, KPA, BAR, and KGCM readouts
Includes bright LED torch for dark roadside conditions, and automatically shuts off in case of over inflation or overheating
cons: Some users have reported issues with attachment hose threads stripping

website_summaries.verdict: A top-notch pick for general inflation needs. It's larger with a higher capacity, which means you can inflate large items in less time.
pros: Large dial to keep track of the current air pressure
Very adaptable in terms of the types of things you can inflate
cons: Too large to realistically use for on-the-go activities outside of the home or car

website_summaries.verdict: Popular, reliable, durable all-rounder comes with its own smart carry case.
pros: Reads in PSI, BAR, KPA, and KGCM
cons: Will not handle truck, pick-up or large SUV tires
Combined reach of air hose and cable just 10 feet

customer_reviews.title: I got a dud. Didn't return it quickly enough.
customer_reviews.text: Pump stopped working after first use. Shame on me for not returning it in time. Looks like most people are satisfied with theirs, but it's unfortunate there also seem to be quite a few duds. Just be sure to test it out right away and return it quickly if it stops working.
customer_reviews.author: r. boucher

customer_reviews.title: Poor quality...threads inside attachment hose.
customer_reviews.text: Update 07.23.17 Used replacement unit and had identical problem. After 3 uses the threads inside hose sort of went away. The metal used for threads quickly erode and you can no longer mount the compressor hose to valve stem. Threw inflator into trash. Extremely dissatisfied. Oh well, life goes on. Update 04.25.17 Seller agreed to send replacement unit 5 days ago but has failed to ship as promised. According to seller, Amazon is responsible for the delay. The threads inside of attachment hose extremely soft and have actually worn down after approximately 10 uses. Makes attaching hose to tire stem nearly impossible.
customer_reviews.author: NK

customer_reviews.title: Dead after 2 months
customer_reviews.text: This had previously been a 5 star review. When I first bought this I had no problems with it. 2 months later I was helping a guy stranded on the road. The compressor won't kick in. It's been sitting in my car untouched since the first and only time I used it. Led and pressure gauge work, but no compressor.
customer_reviews.author: Jafet Hernandez

customer_reviews.title: AWESOME! Would definitely buy again! Used for my boat trailer.
customer_reviews.text: This is the best air pump I've ever owned! My family has always kept air pumps in case of emergency. My last one I got on discount at a store and it was terrible. This pump is great! I bought it for my boat trailer. It pumped up the tires, with my heavy boat on the trailer, and worked great! I love that you can set it to the correct PSI and then just walk away. Great buy!
customer_reviews.author: Skyrida

customer_reviews.title: Just didn't work out of the box
customer_reviews.text: This did not work out of the box for me. I returned it for a better brand name (Die Hard). I set it up to pump in 30PSI and it would start, then all of the sudden just stop at 16.5 and never start up again even If i turned it on or off. I wouldn't recommend this.
customer_reviews.author: Nathan Orchardsin

customer_reviews.title: Pump never came on
customer_reviews.text: Product defective. Did not work right out of the box. I followed directions accurately,plunging into cigarette lighter with engine running. The flash light came on solid-could not turn off. Hooked up to tire valve stem, digital readout came on and I set the desired pressure. Turned switch to on position--nothing! I am returning to Amazon, thank goodness for Prime returns and refunds!!!
customer_reviews.author: fordm14

customer_reviews.title: Didn't work and blew my fuse
customer_reviews.text: Followed the instructions exactly yet my tire was losing pressure while I heard a hissing sound coming from the machine. It didn't make any other sounds. When I removed it from the tire and tested it the compressor turned on as expected. I put it back on the tire and the compressor didn't turn on. I kept trying for a few seconds and suddenly the light and display turn off. It blew my 20A fuse. This product was not worth my time. I had to replace my fuse and refill my tire manually.
customer_reviews.author: Eduardo Jimenez

customer_reviews.title: Garbage
customer_reviews.text: Garbage. Took it out with me on a wheeling trip and the thing filled up all 4 of my 33inch tires from 18-33psi each tire. It couldn't fill up my tires more than 33psi.Then the next time I needed it, it threw an error code and refused to pump. Returned it.
customer_reviews.author: EkV

customer_reviews.title: Broke immediately upon use.
customer_reviews.text: Completely broke after putting about half a pound of air in one tire. Verified its not the 12v connector as old compressor i had still works and swapped fuses etc. The light and current pressure indicator work completely fine but the compressor will no longer turn on whatsoever after less than 30 seconds of use.
customer_reviews.author: Charles Daniel Tingle

customer_reviews.title: Slow but nice Auto shutoff
customer_reviews.text: Not as fast as other 1cfm pumps I have had. There are good points though. 1. It automatically turns off 2. Nice quality air hose 3. Digital display There are several things I don't like though... 1. Much slower than my last 3 pumps 2. Short air hose 3. Gets much hotter than my others. I am concerned about early failure of the motor. 4. Did I mention slow already??? It is fine too put in our Prius for the rare emergency in the cold but not beefy enough for our SUVs.
customer_reviews.author: B. Andrews

customer_reviews.title: Great! Everyone should have one.
customer_reviews.text: The best pump I've owned by far. It is very small and suprisingly quiet. You can barely hear it if you are on the opposite side of the car. Great build quality and comes with it's own little bag. It also stops automatically to the psi you specify! Super cool.
customer_reviews.author: David Fumero

customer_reviews.title: ) I hate it. You have to play with thread the ...
customer_reviews.text: So, I don't know when the compressor work decided to dump the old clamp on air nozzle in favor of a screw on type. (If you don't know what I mean, take a close look at the picture.) I hate it. You have to play with thread the darn thing to your tire nozzle while its hissing air at you. What was wrong with the old bike pump style nozzle? Annoying.
customer_reviews.author: Entropy21

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't Work!
customer_reviews.text: This product didn't even work once for me. Engine on, connected to 12V port, attached to tire valve, set to desired psi, turned the switch and nothing! I lost more air in my tire by trying to get this product to work. Very disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Linda

customer_reviews.title: Great value!!
customer_reviews.text: Great value for this little compact pump. Takes a couple of minutes but that is not a big deal. I bought this when I noted a nail in my tire with a slow leak. I don’t want to go to a tire shop during this COVID19 crisis. I am a nurse and I am avoiding all non essential places as instructed. I don’t HAVE to drive this car daily so I will pump it up if I need at and fix the tire when it is safe to go out again.
customer_reviews.author: jaskjk

customer_reviews.title: For occasional emergency use only
customer_reviews.text: Compressor overheats after about 20 minutes. I was able to inflate 2 tires from 20psi to 35psi before the compressor quit on me. After cool down (about one hour) I was able to inflate the other 2 tires. Given the low price I think three stars are appropriate. Compressor really slows down around 30psi and there is no way it would reach 100psi as the title claims.
customer_reviews.author: Ax.

customer_reviews.title: Bought approximately a month back. started malfunctioning last week ...
customer_reviews.text: Bought approximately a month back. started malfunctioning last week but worked after some effort. When I tried using today, it does not switch on. I just passed the return window (July 22nd) and tried calling their customer service number (800-349-0716) numerous time today but all the time goes on voice mail. No call back yet. Seller/Manufacturer, Can you please replace this product? I did buy it about a month back and have only used a couple of times. Please contact me @ Ravi - 917-488-0032.
customer_reviews.author: Ravi

customer_reviews.title: Motor Stopped working
customer_reviews.text: After receiving the pump, I found out that you can't the the flashlight off, it stays on. But I didn't mind that, saying to myself as long as the pump works, I'm fine with that. After about 7-8 times of use, now the pump doesn't work at all. The flashlight still on. I guess you get what you pay for.
customer_reviews.author: Andy Tang

customer_reviews.title: Blew my car's 15 amp fuse...twice.
customer_reviews.text: I turned my car engine on, plugged the compressor into an outlet w/ a 15 amp fuse (manufacturer recommends using 10-15 amp fuse) and the compressor immediately blew my Honda CRV's fuse. I tried again in a different socket, thinking I must have turned the compressor on before plugging it into the socket. It blew the second fuse, too. However, it did not blow the compressor's included fuse. EP Auto responded by saying they would send out a replacement. I will update if anything changes.
customer_reviews.author: JustnJoy

customer_reviews.title: Thought the fuse blew but I put a meter on it and it was fine. Could not get it to power up again
customer_reviews.text: First time I tried to use it plugged it in it powered on and displayed the psi in the tire. I increased the psi and turned it on and it immediately turned off before any air was pumped. Thought the fuse blew but I put a meter on it and it was fine. Could not get it to power up again. Returned it.
customer_reviews.author: Matt

customer_reviews.title: Works
customer_reviews.text: My daughter received a "road" kit for her car, an electric air pump, and jumper cables and reflectors. Sadly her air pump didn't work. It would not pump her tires up to a level of adequate air pressure. She has a Chevy Equinox. Not really a truck, but bigger tires than a car. This pump was able to fill her tires adequately. Follow the instructions of use, you should be more than happy with it.
customer_reviews.author: Keith

customer_reviews.title: Hiss of air
customer_reviews.text: I bought this last summer and kept in storage for whenever an emergency occurred. Used it for the first time today and it barely releases a hiss of air. Turned it on and off a few times. Worked for a minute the way it should. Next try it was a hiss. Mine is a lemon. My fault for not testing it out when I first got it. Just figured, it's brand new and has great ratings, what are the chances it doesn't work? I wasted $35 on a faulty product.
customer_reviews.author: Beverly L

customer_reviews.title: Works, but does not automatically shut off.
customer_reviews.text: The product worked in that is pumped to the correct PSI, but it did not stop automatically at all. The screen would just stay at 40PSI while the device kept on pumping. So that makes me question the whole device, is it even displaying correctly, had to manually turn off in the end. Additionally it heats up very quickly, had to turn it off after pumping two wheels from 35 psi to 40 psi. Its better to have it than not, but clearly there's some QA issues.
customer_reviews.author: Luke

customer_reviews.title: Not what I expected
customer_reviews.text: This item defect right after 1 month later , it works great when purchased, but since few days ago , it start working werid and till today , when I plug in and it don't turn on , and I realized it is broken .. the money only last for one month, so beware friend .
customer_reviews.author: Leonardo

customer_reviews.title: Works great! And easy to use.
customer_reviews.text: If my non-mechanical daughter can use this, anybody can! It attaches to the tire valve easily and then measures the pressure. You just push the button and set the desired pressure and this little blue devil pumps and automatically stops when it’s done. Perfect pressure every time - easy peasy. It’s all digital so easy to see the numbers. It even has a bright LED light built in so you can see things if it’s dark. We use it to keep all our tires at the correct pressures when the weather gets cold and the tires deflate like Brady’s footballs.
customer_reviews.author: Raquel

customer_reviews.title: Cool compressor, Great customer service
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this compressor, and had used it a few times, all with satisfactory results. But one day, the chuck tip wouldn't unscrew off of the tire valve stem, all the while letting the air out; the tire went completely flat. Frankly, that's when I panicked, and cut the chuck tip off of the hose. So then, I called Customer Service at EP Family Direct to ask them if they could sell me a replacement nozzle, I spoke with 'Luke'. Quietly, he listened to my description of the mishap, and blew my mind by declaring that he was going to send me a replacement unit, no charge. That response was completely unexpected, and quite extraordinary. Great customer service! Thank you.
customer_reviews.author: Chandler

customer_reviews.title: Hubby says it's this air compressor is AWesome and super simple to operate
customer_reviews.text: Hubby says it's this air compressor is AWesome and super simple to operate. The cord is long enough, unit is small, compact and stores conveniently in it's own bag. Set the psi then let it go, stops when psi is reached!!! The large illuminated panel can be easily viewed in daylight. We just leave it in the trunk for just in case and is a must when we take the camper out! This can inflate bike tires and balls in a jiffy.
customer_reviews.author: Browniegirl

customer_reviews.title: Works great.
customer_reviews.text: I love this little thing. Turn your car on, plug it into your cigarette plug, screw the hose onto the tire stem, see what the tire pressure is on the digital screen set the tire pressure to what you want it to be, flip the switch. Easy. The compressor comes with a little bag to put it in when not in use, and the entire thing is so small you can put it in your trunk and forget about it until the next time that annoying tire pressure light comes on your dash.
customer_reviews.author: J. D. R.

customer_reviews.title: Update: Don't Buy this one!
customer_reviews.text: Update: My comments still stand, but I purchased a VIAIR that costs $10 more than this but is of tremendously higher quality and power. It has a much better connection screw, sturdier and longer line, emits about 1/2 the noise, and inflates in 1/4 the time. And while there's no auto-shutoff, it has a nice dial gauge and it's so fast you don't even need the auto-shutoff feature. Original Review: This thing is a champion. The gauge isn’t super trustworthy, but the auto-shutoff gets you in the ballpark with EXTREME convenience. And I love the “just the essentials” design- makes for easy storage in pretty much any vehicle cubby hole.
customer_reviews.author: Aaron K.

customer_reviews.title: This thing really worked!
customer_reviews.text: I had very low expectations, but was pleasantly surprised. I thought is would be so slow pumping up my tires, but it was fast. Also, I can set the tire pressure and it stops at the set amount of pressure. I had a bit of trouble pressing the middle button which was not completely responsive but now it is set on psi so I don’t really need it anymore. HINT: set it on a half pound more than you need because the screw off connection causes a small loss of air when you take it off. I am so pleased and I can take it everywhere with me.
customer_reviews.author: L. Lynch

customer_reviews.title: Great Portable Air Compressor
customer_reviews.text: We love this portable air compressor for offroading. We frequently get two flats off road and carry one spare. Between a plug kit and this compressor tire repairs offroad become much more manageable. We had the one that came with the AAA emergency kit before and it tended to get very hot filling 33 inch tires, however this can handle the big job. It has a warning not to use longer than 10 minutes without giving it a break, but sometimes you need to go longer and this compressor seems to be up for the job.
customer_reviews.author: Sassieluvs

customer_reviews.title: The best one I had so far
customer_reviews.text: After two flat tires in a week, I bought three inflators in my cars. The is the best one. It can fill the empty tires in minutes, and it is very quiet. The only thing I couldn't figure it out is how can I turn off the LED light. ( just find out the led light is always on for the purpose" lets others seeing you".)
customer_reviews.author: FrankRPC

customer_reviews.title: In Your Face Poorly Maintained Gas Station Air Pumps (I'm only a little bitter)
customer_reviews.text: Great product. Very compact and easy to use once you use it a time or 2. I also thought the price was more than reasonable and it'll be nice not being nickel and dimed when trying to inflate my tires at the gas station (only to find that the compressor is broken after you pay for it). Before you purchase this item make sure that your vehicle was the proper fuse for the cigarette lighter (what the item uses as it's power source). Can verify that it works for an '05 Subaru Forester XT and a '06 Scion XA.
customer_reviews.author: Johnny S.

customer_reviews.title: Stopped Working When I needed it most
customer_reviews.text: This product did not even make the 3 year mark, and is now a useless piece of junk. Use was very light and was stored carefully. It failed to start yesterday and bleed air from the tire while doing it! Now I have a tire with 12 PSI. I would love to hear from the seller, but there is no contact info. I fail to understand how it got so many positive reviews. I will never buy from them again, unless they wish to replace the defective item LL
customer_reviews.author: lowelaw

customer_reviews.title: Compressor
customer_reviews.text: New to RV lifestyle. Love this little guy. Just attach to the tire, set the PSI, turn on and it will auto stop when the PSI is reached. Will say that u may have to play around with the connection point to properly activate the airflow. If the compressor vibrates a lot, u do not have a secure connection. There should be a steady hum without any vibration. It's not required but I recommend a little break in between consecutive fills to prevent overheating. I noticed better subsequent fills worked better after a break. Note that this is a small compressor so it may take some time if your item needs a lot of air. Stores nicely.
customer_reviews.author: Rob Dawg

customer_reviews.title: it didn't even work
customer_reviews.text: I should have tested the product out when I first received it. I left it there in a corner of the house for a few months thinking I trust all the positive reviews. This was so wrong. The day that I needed to put more air into my car tires this thing didn't even work! It was like there was a leak or something, the tires never receive air. Of course I couldn't return it because it's already been a few months. The quality check of this is horrible.
customer_reviews.author: It's me

customer_reviews.title: Works Well and Very Handy
customer_reviews.text: Good to have along on road trips, and especially nice if you're the type to check and adjust tire pressures every month (as is recommended). After several months of use the fitting that screws onto the tire valve stem broke. I had to find out what this part is called to get a replacement as parts are apparently not available from the company. Turns out it's called a "lock on chuck" or a "screw on chuck" and you want the one with the one quarter inch barb connector, available from Amazon.
customer_reviews.author: Roderic Fabian

customer_reviews.title: Works great so far
customer_reviews.text: Needed to make some extra room in the garage so I got rid of my old large compressor and got this instead. TPM went off on my car yesterday so I got to try it for the first time. It was extremely simple to use and MUCH quieter than my old traditional compressor. Just hooked it up, dialed in the pressure, and let it rip. Disconnecting it releases such a TINY amount of air if you're careful, so I don't know what some others are complaining about with that. Checked the pressures afterwards and all were dead on. Only time will tell on how long this thing will last, but right now it's perfect for me.
customer_reviews.author: John_nj

customer_reviews.title: Tiny and Powerful
customer_reviews.text: I gotta say. I didn't think it was going to work as well it did. It seemed awfully small in comparison to other ones that I've used the past, however, it worked and it worked damn well. It's really small, the LED light is convenient and BRIGHT. I just so happened to have low tire pressure from the drop in temperature outside. So I pulled this bad boy out, screwed it on to the tire valve told it what pressure to set it to, and let it do it's thing. It was simple easy. Simple, compact, comes with it's own bag, the whole 9 yards!
customer_reviews.author: Lucas

customer_reviews.title: Works but its very slowwwwwwwww
customer_reviews.text: This is a nice portable device and it is useful to have in times of emergency but this thing is soooooo slow! if you tire is down to the point to where its flat this thing could take like 15 mins to pump up. Overheat protection works correctly as it shuts off when I was trying to inflate 4 tires for someone. So if you have all day to wait I suggest you get this one but if you want to pump your tire up in a hurry, stay away from this because this thing is way to slow. I honestly wouldnt recommend it for this main reason.
customer_reviews.author: Lo

customer_reviews.title: NOT for prolonged use!
customer_reviews.text: If you need to regularly air up your tires, i.e. all four of them after deflating for a 4x4 trail, this is NOT the on-trail compressor for you b/c it overheats easily and shuts off - dramatically increasing air-up times. It's inflation rate is approximately 1 psi / minute on a 265/70/R16 (2018 Tacoma stock) tire at 4500ft elevation. Re-airing 10 psi per tire is over 50 mins total (even in colder temps). Perhaps it's ok for motorcycle, bicycle, occasional use, etc. I guess the good news is that the compressor does shut off and not kill itself. If rated for consistently shutting itself off? 5 stars!
customer_reviews.author: Patton Massengill

customer_reviews.title: Tends to overheat
customer_reviews.text: Tried this unit for the first time on my sister's Jeep Commander. Admittedly the tires were very low on air but I was surprised that after inflating two tires the motor cut out. The unit was very hot to the touch so I sat it over an air conditioner vent for about 30 minutes. After inflating the third tire it required another cool down. I would recommend either a bigger motor or better cooling.
customer_reviews.author: Martinex

customer_reviews.title: Broke when I tried to pump to 65 lbs
customer_reviews.text: Broke when I tried to pump to 65 lbs. Used several time on 34 lbs with good results. When I tried to go to 65 lbs the pump popped. The motor runs fine, but just blows air out around the pump housing. The pump is worthless now.
customer_reviews.author: Dede

customer_reviews.title: Does not work for bikes.
customer_reviews.text: I was about to leave for work on my bicycle, but decided to fill my tires with air. Initially it worked great. It even indicated my tires PSI ( Pound per Square Inch). Unfortunately, the device does not come with a thump lock (the feature in which it locks in order to prevent air from coming out). As soon as I began to unscrew the device (while still on) all the air came out. Half the air in the tires came out within 2 seconds. I ended up walking to the nearest gas station to fill up the tires. I did not try this on my car tires, maybe it works great. But I do not recommend this for bicycles!
customer_reviews.author: Yaudy Fernandez

customer_reviews.title: Actually works great!
customer_reviews.text: Didn't think it would work that great,but at this price point was,willing to take a shot. Bought it mainly for the tires on the lawnmower and was pleased how quickly it filled them with the necessary 10 pounds. Then tried the car tires... no problem, 33 pounds and not a hiccup. This is smaller than I imagined but works just as advertised. Very quiet and the digital readout with automatic cutoff after reaching the required pressure was a another great feature. Had another brand of inflator years ago that sounded like a jackhammer but couldn't inflate a basketball. This one does what is says with no complaint. An easy 5 star rating!
customer_reviews.author: Eddie D

customer_reviews.title: Junk
customer_reviews.text: It's poorly made--will not start if it's "hot," which means it can do one tire and that's it. Or, if you live in Arizona, it won't start at all unless it's stored indoors. Worthless.
customer_reviews.author: Buyer in AZ

customer_reviews.title: the valve chuck will break after 1-2 years.
customer_reviews.text: Useful for 1 year (I fixed my tractor tire when I got a nail in the middle of my back yard...). repaired and inflated. It also helped here and there... However, when I needed the most, the supercheap brass pin, inside the chuck, the one pushing the valve pin, broke off..... garbage. Probably made of the cheapest possible soft brass. I have been inflating cars for 30 years and this is the first time I get this failure... Anyway, I am getting a new chuck and I hope I can cut the hose and connect a better one. Otherwise the compressor goes straight to trash. Beware of this product. It might betray you when you need it the most.
customer_reviews.author: Stefano

customer_reviews.title: Failed after sitting in my trunk, worthless when I needed it
customer_reviews.text: I used it when it was new and it worked as advertised and was convenient. It sat in its bag for 6 months in my trunk and when I had a flat that I desperately needed it, it failed with flashing "Err" on its display.
customer_reviews.author: DaveT

customer_reviews.title: just okay
customer_reviews.text: Pump has a digital scale for automatic shut-off but the fitting that goes to the tire stem is threaded by the time you unthread it you lost enough air pressure that it makes the digital scale useless. Not sure why that was the chosen fitting. It should have been the flip lever fitting or just a fitting that you press on until it reaches the desired pressure and then release.
customer_reviews.author: Boost882

customer_reviews.title: Nifty air pressure pump
customer_reviews.text: This is a very nice pump. Plugs into 12V car socket. Measures current tire pressure. Press the + button to increase to desired pressure. Very quickly inflates, showing pressure as it goes. Stops automatically at desired pressure. Has variety of tips for inflating balls, etc. LED Light will be extremely helpful if I have to do this at night. Includes a little carry bag.
customer_reviews.author: J D.

customer_reviews.title: Not very powerful
customer_reviews.text: I generally like this product. 1) Its sleek design allows for easy. 2) Great low price. 3) Carrying case. 4) Lit PSI gauge. 5) Auto shut-off is good. Here's what I don't like: 1) The bright LED light doesn't have an off button. 2) It is not powerful. I have a 2005 Dodge Grand Caravan. Tires were at 30PSI, and I was only able to inflate 2 to 40PSI; then it overheated and shut off. 3) The box was taped shut with scotch tape and had fingerprints all over the air cylinder. It was obviously used and NOT new.
customer_reviews.author: Ben Nistor

customer_reviews.title: Must have one in every car
customer_reviews.text: This is the 2nd one that I have purchased. It's so good I'm giving one to my son for the holidays You have to carry one in each car. Usually when the seasons Change that's when the tire pressure drops. No more concerns here. Take this bad boy out of the car and in 5 minutes I'm on my way. Don't have to look for a gas station and hope I have enough quarters for the air.
customer_reviews.author: Tommy Boy

customer_reviews.title: Can't handle the Texas heat.
customer_reviews.text: This pump works. It inflated my Civic's wheels to 35 psi and my dad's F150's wheels to his liking. However you can't leave this pump in a car because it can't handle hot temperatures. Which essentially make this a handheld pump for traveling. It's still a great value when you consider how expensive a personal air compressor is. Sadly this isn't a get set and forget item to keep in your car if you live in a hot place.
customer_reviews.author: Johan

customer_reviews.title: I have also recommended this to other family members
customer_reviews.text: I got this product a month or so ago. I was surprised to see how compact and light weight it is. I had to put it to use already once during a road trip recently. One of tires was indicating low pressure. I pulled over, whipped this puppy out, inflated the tire and was on my way back on the road in 5 minutes. A guy parked in the next stall came over to look. He was impressed. I gave him the brand name and told him I got it from Amazon. I have also recommended this to other family members.
customer_reviews.author: R. Seshan

customer_reviews.title: Cheap durable use it all the time
customer_reviews.text: I don't understand the poor reviews I love this product and I would purchase it over the ones that cost less or more but I don't have the need to because I use this all the time Weatherby my vehicle or what's someone else's instead of having to feed the machine at the gas station a dollar a dollar fifty or a dollar 75 or whatever this thing is paid for itself and Beyond with the convenience I'm not having to find a gas station I can air up all of my tires even the display is fairly accurate although I do double check with a good air pressure gauge it seems to very accurate
customer_reviews.author: Dan Schroeder

customer_reviews.title: Loses a lot of air during setup
customer_reviews.text: I got the inflator for my birthday last month and finally went out to try it. I'm not totally impressed. It certainly pumps. However, in order to screw on the inflator (it requires twisting on the threads) you end up losing about 10 pounds of pressure. And afterwards you lose about 1 pound when you remove the inflator. So if you are at 32 and want 34, you have to twist on the inflator and that drops it to the low 20's. Then you need to wait for inflation all the way to about 35 or 36, so that it drops to 34 when you remove. Hard to give this more than 2 stars.
customer_reviews.author: brandon.b

customer_reviews.title: I went with the flow because rated the best
customer_reviews.text: Originally even though this had the highest reviews on other sites as well, I wasn't going to order it because it just look bigger than the others. What motivated me is that it came with a bag so it could easily be put in my car. When it arrived, I was pleased that it was much smaller than I thought it was and the accuracy when you set the air pressure is right on compared to other reviews where it might be plus or minus 1psi. I'm really happy I decided to buy the one that others rated best also. It's pumped up a tire that was nearly completely flat to 35 PSI in a couple minutes. I was impressed.
customer_reviews.author: Radiospotz

customer_reviews.title: Died quickly and no warranty
customer_reviews.text: I bought in September, 2018 and probably used it to add pressure to already inflated tires over multiple days maybe 10 times before the unit died yesterday. Based on other people leaving comments, it sounds like there is no product warranty, unless you purchased it long enough ago that they tell you there is a warranty but it's expired. I find this product listing extremely deceptive and will not be replacing this pump with another one.
customer_reviews.author: Elena

customer_reviews.title: Good value
customer_reviews.text: The compressor is very easy to use. Nice feature to have it stop when it reaches the correct air pressure. It is quiet - compared to others I have previously owned. Very useful to have in the car. Two cons - the unit's pressure reading it slightly higher than my old fashioned stick tire pressure gauges. Easy enough to make an adjustment, but the reading does not seem to be completely accurate (only off by about 1.5 lbs). Also the screw on nozzle is not quite as nice as the standard snap on. End up loosing a little more air when disconnecting, although not a major issue. Overall a good value.
customer_reviews.author: David S Moore

customer_reviews.title: Worked fine until it died, way too young
customer_reviews.text: July 2019- I'm being sent a replacement; will see how that one holds up and adjust if warranted. Just gave up the ghost- I had used it to very occasionally pump up a bike tire. I probably got no more than a couple dozen uses out of it before the pump stopped pumping. Light comes on, but no one's home. When it was working it was fine- I would prefer the clamp-on valve over the screw-on, as you can lose quite a bit of air while unscrewing, but it was adequate. I've emailed, and am waiting for a response. There's a customer service/repair # on the pump I'll call next.
customer_reviews.author: Steve

customer_reviews.title: So glad I found this product!
customer_reviews.text: A common feature of my type of car is that the air pressure sensors will go on every few months. While having to find a gas station with air is nothing to complain about, it can be challenging to measure the PSI and fill the tires properly within the minute or so you have before the air shuts off. I thought the instructions for the pump were somewhat unclear, but I eventually figured it out. It is really helpful to be able to program the pump to stop filling at a certain air level so you also get a more accurate reading than if you were using the manual pressure reader at a gas station.
customer_reviews.author: Jessica Leano

customer_reviews.title: Works as expected
customer_reviews.text: I hate leaving my house. I would always forget my tires were low and I needed to fill them at the gas station. I hate interacting with random people to ask them to turn on the air. Now I don't have to leave my house to fill my tires or talk to anyone. Fantastic. Use on both cars worked well. I also like that you can choose the PSI first and it auto-fills to the option because I'm awful at car things and always struggled to read the meters at gas stations. 10/10 suggest for other ladies who hate dealing with car stuff.
customer_reviews.author: Faye

customer_reviews.title: This air compressor is amazing!
customer_reviews.text: I know this sounds ridiculous but I think I'm a little in love with this air compressor. I will give the caveat that I've only used it once but it is so easy to use and the digital display accurately measures the tire pressure. I've had portable air compressors in the past but I didn't feel they measured the tire pressure well at all. With this, the tire pressure popped up instantly and I could see the tires inflating quickly and knew when to stop. It was so quick and easy to fill my tires. I can't say enough good things. I'm going to recommend it to my family.
customer_reviews.author: db001

customer_reviews.title: Quiet and fast
customer_reviews.text: I spent a long time searching the internet for the quietest air pump, watching videos to compare the noise levels, and realizing I'm the only nerd probably caring about this so I'll keep it short. This pump is super easy to use and seems to be the quietest on the market. Nozzle: Get one with the plastic grippy nozzle. I originally had the red one but when I got it, the nozzle was the metal one with no grip. I returned it and got the blue version which luckily had the easier to use nozzle. Check the pictures on Amazon closely.
customer_reviews.author: Alex

customer_reviews.title: A great replacement for an old Home Depot Husky brand compressor
customer_reviews.text: I've used this product a few times to maintain the correct pressure on my tires, and here's what I like about this compressor: It's very quiet compared to my old Husky compressor purchased from Home Depot many years ago. It seems a bit faster than the Husky pump. It's smaller than the Husky pump, so it doesn't take up much space in the trunk of the car. I like the connection that screws into the nipple of the tire. I like the digital reading screen that allows you to set the pressure to automatically turn off the compressor. I WOULD RECOMMEND THIS PRODUCT.
customer_reviews.author: F. Han

customer_reviews.title: Great Quality in a Small Package
customer_reviews.text: Bought this vehicle air compressor to keep My truck tires at the appropriate pressure. I've owned several other's in the past. And most of them made more noise than air pressure. And some needed to be stopped just to read the pressure. Making inflation more time consuming. This unit is a well designed and useful compressor. Absolutely recommend it. I've been able to be a good samaritan too. Helping others keep their own vehicles and bicycles tires safely inflated. Which not only improves safety. But also gas mileage, and tire wear. FIVE STARS across the board ! Definitely No Problem !
customer_reviews.author: No Prob Bob

customer_reviews.title: Great little compressor.
customer_reviews.text: It does just what I want it to do. I am plagued with flat or low tire pressure on my cars. This usually happens before leaving for work in the morning when it's dark or when I'm leaving work for home in the evening. Always a hassle. Now I just plug in my portable tire inflator and I'm back in business. The digital read out is very bright and easy to read. It comes in a handy little case and stows in my trunk so it's always with me. I swear one evening I had to stop at 4 gas stations before finding one that had a functioning tire inflator. Now I'm always prepared. Great price too.
customer_reviews.author: Virginia S McMillan

customer_reviews.title: Works well, good price
customer_reviews.text: If not for the short power cord I’d rate 5/5. I set goal pressure exactly to desired # & when I removed screw on hose, it was 1⁄2 - 1 # over. Easy & quick to let air out to reach goal. I had to change which 12V outlet I use when do Rear vs. Front tires... unlike my last compressor which had a longer power cord. Annoying. It does ‘walk’ around a bit when turned on sitting on concrete garage floor or driveway. It has feet that move independently & absorb some vibration so does not walk far but, it DOES walk. For the cost, <$35, well worth it. Recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Iconoclast

customer_reviews.title: Essential
customer_reviews.text: This little air compressor has more than paid for itself since I brought it in Feb 2018. My tire was leaking on the way to a camping trip and instead of having to find a gas station every hour we could just pull into a parking lot and fill it back up with this. The next morning, the tire was completely flat, but I was able to fill it back to 32 PSI in under 10 minutes to take it to the tire shop. Another time I used it to fill all 4 tires and it did start to get quite hot. The instructions say to let it cool off for 30 minutes before using it again.
customer_reviews.author: iguanas

customer_reviews.title: A great little pump if it's treated right and instructions are followed.
customer_reviews.text: I've had mine since a year ago Christmas I regularly top off the tires. No more going down the gas station and dumping quarters. And it's a life saver if you get stuck. It'll let you get to a place that can help you out. The flashlight, air line and power cord can be neatly wrapped and the whole thing stored in your trunk. If you don't need it, great, you're lucky. But if you do, you'll be glad it's there. And the price makes it a no brainer. The new assembly l just bought is for a friend of mine who expressed interest in it.
customer_reviews.author: Harold W. Crean

customer_reviews.title: After I used it three times it went didn't work ...
customer_reviews.text: After I used it three times it went didn't work anymore. I have to buy a new one, of course a different brand.
customer_reviews.author: Neil S

customer_reviews.title: Everything is perfect, except a terrible valve connector
customer_reviews.text: After the first time using it, I was really impressed by how quickly and quietly this pump inflated my tires. The only thing that keeps this from being a 5-star review is the terrible hose connector. I get what they were going for, as my old-trusty craftsman pump had a similar screw-on connector that was exception, but this one leaks terribly when screwing/unscrewing, is super-easy to cross-thread, and is just a miserable experience to use. I think that I'll be keeping the unit, but buying some other adapter or extension hose to make it more pleasant to use.
customer_reviews.author: Osndok

customer_reviews.title: Great Compressor - Well Calibrated - Great Shutoff - Love the 110v option.
customer_reviews.text: I used to have a large 30 gallon compressor and when we moved, my wife insisted on getting rid of it to save space in the garage. I was put off by 12v compressors as they are usually very slow and lack power. This unit is both 12v and 110v which is great. Compresses at a reasonable rate (lb per second or two) and works well with the gauge and shutoff.
customer_reviews.author: ERM

customer_reviews.title: Great purchase, works great! Lightweight, durable & easily packs away for storage.
customer_reviews.text: Bought this to inflate an oversized pet toy. Very happy with how well and efficiently it works. This has more than paid for itself after its first use to inflate an oversized pet tennis ball, giving us and our fur baby nonstop entertainment during lockdown. Lightweight and durable, it easily packs away for storage. We will also use it for the vehicle tires when needed. Great value for the price. It also came with an electronic tire gauge which works great as well. Very happy with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: MLS82

customer_reviews.title: Don’t buy this one. Dangerous
customer_reviews.text: Bought this a few months ago and just had to use it. Popped the 20A cigarette lighter fuse within 5 minutes, nothing to the integrated inline fuse. Put a new fuse in and the second time ran for 20 min before it blew that one too. Threw the thing straight into the trash. Not worth using. Not to mention over the 25 minutes of pumping it was only able to get from 15-35 psi. Had it set to 45.
customer_reviews.author: Kyle

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful gadget, especially for $36.00.
customer_reviews.text: Super handy and great for the price. We use this for our bikes, and both cars. I have a slow leak in one tire that requires topping off once a month or so, and it takes me less than five minutes to set up, connect, fill, store the unit. Auto shut-off and digital pressure display are great. Only downside is that there is no separate switch for the LED lamp, so it's on even in daylight -- not a big deal. This is quieter, easier to use, and faster than my last unit, which cost much more.
customer_reviews.author: MGruson

customer_reviews.title: Mostly Good - but get a calibrated pressure gauge
customer_reviews.text: Nice functionality - quick pumping for pressure - good cord length even for my van - But: the storage bag stores the pump standing up on the back end - not the feet - making the bag fall over every time. Terrible bag design. And I used my doubly calibrated pressure gauge to compare pressure and the device reads 1 1/2 pounds low - which means I would add too much air if I used the device pressure reading. And the light always stays on ! There should be a switch for that when it is not needed - ie daytime.
customer_reviews.author: Neil J. M.

customer_reviews.title: Only Worked Once ):
customer_reviews.text: I used it within a month of getting it once and it worked well, but the second time I used it (3 days after the return window closed) it no longer works! Sounds like there's a whole somewhere because you can feel air escaping where the tube meets the metal. Very disappointed that I couldn't at least get an exchange as I was really excited about all the positive reviews!
customer_reviews.author: Richard Kelly

customer_reviews.title: Amazing
customer_reviews.text: My old national brand tire Inflator lasted about four years and I replaced it with this unit. What a difference. The old one was loud, took forever to inflate and shook across the driveway and would wake the neighbors. Not this unit. It is quiet, and inflates fast. No more waiting for the tire to inflate. The auto shut off is great and accurate. Cord is long enough for my SUV.
customer_reviews.author: Liz Sowa

customer_reviews.title: Great little compressor
customer_reviews.text: This is exactly what I wanted: a compact compressor, that easily stores in the trunk of my car, yet provides enough power to fill my tires. No more paying for air at the gas station. I also love the auto-shut off so I don't have to keep wasting air by using another device to check the pressure. It's great! The only suggestion that I have is that they add the ability to plug it into a wall outlet, so I can bring it inside to fill my exercise balls, bike tires, in the winter, etc. Still worth every penny and I would buy this same model again!
customer_reviews.author: Barbara J.

customer_reviews.title: Does the job.
customer_reviews.text: Worked well to add air to my low air pressure tires on my new suv. Save the hassle of the gas station pumps which are always broken or you have to wait while amateurs try to figure out how stuff works. Have not used it for my bike or basketball yet but if it can do my suv then they should be fine. It does get pretty hot so I am not likely to recommend any heavy extended use. It is really tiny. I leave it in my car after it cools down. Not sure how long it will last but we will see what the long term brings.
customer_reviews.author: S. OD

customer_reviews.title: Stopped working/started smoking after 3 uses
customer_reviews.text: Worked fine the first few times, I like the form factor, the digital display and auto stop is convenient... however, I can't recommend this as mine completely failed after just a few uses. When I flipped it on, the compressor would vibrate briefly as if it was trying to turn over (however, it did this both from switching it "on" and "off" - the power switch didn't seem to make a difference). The fuse became extremely hot within seconds of plugging into the cigarette lighter, and the unit began smoking near the power cable inlet on the compressor. I want to like it, but if it doesn't work it doesn't work. And 3 uses is unacceptable.
customer_reviews.author: Jordan

customer_reviews.title: Works Well
customer_reviews.text: It works very well. I have no issues. I would suggest the power cable be just a bit longer, but you can buy extension cords. I recommend this product to anyone who is tired of driving around trying to find working air towers and then paying $2 for a few minutes of air. Since you can preset the pressure the compressor works well for pool floats and sports equipment too. Great buy!
customer_reviews.author: Wreck67

customer_reviews.title: Small but Good.  Accurate PSI and Quiet
customer_reviews.text: Used it once on both my car (2008 Buick Lacrosse) and bike. Worked well and was much quieter than I thought it would be. The accuracy of the PSI was spot on (see pictures) I went from 25PSI to 35 PSI in about 3 minutes. Bike tires filled up in less than 30 seconds. The one downside is it barely fits in the bag it comes with.
customer_reviews.author: Icehockey2

customer_reviews.title: ‘Tis The Season
customer_reviews.text: I told a tire store employee about this one time and HE was surprised! As temperatures drop across America it’s the season to fill our tires with air. This is typically when I use this pump most often. I actually own two of these and recently bought a third car so it’s time to buy another one. I love that I can set the pressure exactly where I want it and this pump will put it there. Want all 4 tires at the same pressure? Done. My front right tire was about .5 PSI over and my TPMS read it as a whole number higher. Not a big deal. You can in see the picture that they’re all super close.
customer_reviews.author: G1AC0M0

customer_reviews.title: its not a bad little pump
customer_reviews.text: Neat little pump, but takes a long long time to fill a flat tire. Took me maybe 10-15minutes with car running to completely fill my flat tire. Other than how slow it fills up, its not a bad little pump.
customer_reviews.author: Cameron

customer_reviews.title: I just received this today and it is awesome! I live in Minnesota and every time the ...
customer_reviews.text: I just received this today and it is awesome! I live in Minnesota and every time the temperature drops the tires on my small commuter car deflate. I went out the other morning to a completely flat rear tire. I decided that instead of paying for air (ridiculous) that I would give this air compressor a try. It inflated the flat tire within minutes and then worked on the other three that were under inflated without issue. It's compact, has its own bag and fits nicely in my trunk. And, more importantly, it was super easy to use. I'm hoping it will serve me well in the years to come. Great product.
customer_reviews.author: footske

customer_reviews.title: Great little accessory
customer_reviews.text: I love this little compressor! Ever since I rolled my car off the lot, my "Tire Pressure Monitoring System" indicator has lit up like a Christmas tree. Sometimes it's the weather, sometimes it's air pressure, and sometimes I think the thing is just bored. Anyway, it had me stressed out. In the event I did need air, most of the gas station air machines take cash...which I rarely have. I keep this compressor in my trunk now. It's compact, efficient, and easy to use. The light is a great touch. I bought one for my mom recently as a gift as well. Highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Mary F.

customer_reviews.title: Great Pump!
customer_reviews.text: Just received the pump about 1 week ago. It appears to be a well made pump and worked well during my brief trial. I believe that it will meet my needs. One thing that I was somewhat surprised about was the LED light on the end is on continuously. We have smaller cars (Honda Civic and Outback) and I found that the power cord was just long enough to reach the front and rear tires using the same dash mounted 12 volt receptacle. If you were inflating tires on a large vehicle or RV, the short power cord might be an issue.
customer_reviews.author: Phone Buyer

customer_reviews.title: Quiet, Power
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this as a replacement for my previous air compressor that broke. I was originally looking for something with the dual option of being able to plug into an outlet for home use, but the reviews made me give this one a try. I've only used it once so far, but what an amazing little gadget. So much faster than my old compressor, that one took forever to inflate my tires. And talk about quiet! This makes about a third of the noise. Also love the carrying case to keep everything neat and tidy in my trunk.
customer_reviews.author: Kimberly M. Cox

customer_reviews.title: Life saver!
customer_reviews.text: I've unfortunately had to use this more than I would have hoped since buying it, but it has come in handy EVERY single time that I've needed to use it, so much so that I keep it in the car with me rather than the trunk like I used to. Not only is it faster than my last unit, but it's also much quieter! I love the digital display, it's super helpful, I'd say my only complaint right now is that you can't turn the light off (but who cares?). Will update as needed but so far this thing is a winner and at a good price!
customer_reviews.author: Rome

customer_reviews.title: Does ok
customer_reviews.text: This thing is loud! I bought it for my mom's car cause her rear right tire kept going from 42 psi to 26 or less. I read the instructions and set the recommended psi and this product read 30.5 when her car read 44. I wouldn't recommend it to people without the tire pressure monitoring installed to their car.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon_Queen

customer_reviews.title: Flat out awesome
customer_reviews.text: I had to replace my 15yr old cheapie compressor and was blown away at the quality and features of this compressor. It turns itself off, has a screw on connection to the tire and is incredibly quiet. I regret not buying this before. I recommended it to 3 friends and 2 of them bought it. Both love it. The third friend is stupid so I am writing them off. Great compressor. If you are not handy it is easy to use. If you are handy it saves you a lot of hassle. I highly recommend this compressor.
customer_reviews.author: FixItFrank

customer_reviews.title: Threads stripped out
customer_reviews.text: After a few months the threaded adapter stripped out. I ended up throwing it away, because there was no fix available. The concept was great and when it worked, I loved it. But, it was simply too poorly built to function long-term. Make a brass adapter and this would be a great pump.
customer_reviews.author: Rick Prescott

customer_reviews.title: We've had this for years
customer_reviews.text: I'm just getting around to leaving a review. We've had this for years and it still works great. My husband gave me some you-know-what for getting this. But my last experience at the gas station air-pump was not all that pleasant. So I came home and purchased this immediately after. It's perfect, easy to use and very compact. Guess who uses it all the time now... Yep, my husband, LOL. I use it too, but his car needs it more than mine and now he's happy I got it.
customer_reviews.author: Chrissy

customer_reviews.title: Great for winter low tire pressure
customer_reviews.text: great for emergencies. Put in my trunk. Use it a lot during winter time. My tires always has low pressure on winter. With this device. Saved me a lot of trips going to gas station to have my tire pumped. Most times it’s very long wait on the gas station. But now I can just do it in my garage. Warm and fast.
customer_reviews.author: yong weng

customer_reviews.title: Great compact tire inflator with digital readout and bright headlight.
customer_reviews.text: This is a great small pump inflator that stores easily. Plug has long cord that reaches cigarette lighter easily. I have a slow leak on rear tire and this tool really pumps up tire nicely. From 17 lb psi to 39 lb psi takes about 12-15 minutes. Very quiet operation and even has a light that comes on once plugged into dc outlet. Unit does get hot in summer after 15 minutes to be aware of putting away after use. Have been using regularly for 6 months and still runs strong.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff T.

customer_reviews.title: Compressor worked flawlessly
customer_reviews.text: This is my first purchase of a product from EPAuto. The portable air compressor works flawlessly...I particularly like the feature that allows you to set the pressure you want to achieve in the tire and it goes to that pressure and shuts off...it eliminates the need to keep checking the pressure by hand which I have always disliked. The customer experience with EPAuto was very good. I did not have to contact them, they instead sent a proactive email detailing how to operate the compressor...then they sent a followup email to ensure I was not having problems. Overall a first class experience.
customer_reviews.author: Charlie G

customer_reviews.title: FANTASTIC!
customer_reviews.text: This thing actually works. I keep my tires 100% equally inflated everyday. It's part of my everyday routine now before I go anywhere. The ride is much nicer on my 2015 Juke SL. Pros: It works. Illuminated Digital Tire Gauge Extra Fuse Extra connections for different applications like inflating a basketball Zipper Carrying case Cons: The front LED will always stay on when plugged in. Shortens the life of the front LED lights. Was sent Used product. Overall, even though I was sent a used product, I still love this thing!
customer_reviews.author: [lgm] ARTS

customer_reviews.title: Works great...and faster than I expected...
customer_reviews.text: This is exactly the tire pump I was looking for...small enough to fit easily into the trunk, a self-shutoff at the correct pressure and easy to use. I have only used it twice since the purchase, but it's worked perfectly each time. Some have had concerns about the screw-on hose rather than a clip on. I've had no problem with it. I've noticed that the pump gives you an extra pound of air (41 pounds when set for 40) which allows for any air that might be lost while unscrewing the connection. This is a great addition to my emergency equipment package in my automobile.
customer_reviews.author: Dennis S.

customer_reviews.title: Small but it works.
customer_reviews.text: Well I picked up a small nail I believe ironically enough at a dealership which is being done over, and I started paying $1.50 a whack at a big tire compressor. Not to mention the inconvience of driving to the compressor. But I digress, to the point, this cute little compressor is the real deal. I started my car, plugged it in to the cig lighter, set the limit level and this little workhorse started pumping away, and at the designated limit it stopped just like that. You should add it to your auto repair inventory.
customer_reviews.author: Fred Dean

product_meta.title: EPAuto 12V DC Portable Air Compressor Pump, Digital Tire Inflator
feature_bullets: Convenience: Plug directly into Cigarette Lighter Socket of your Vehicle. 12VDC, 10 to 15 amps, 120 to 180W. Equipped with 12V-DC Cigarette Lighter Socket Plug, NOT 110V AC plug.

Multiple Uses: Inflate tires on cars, bikes, sedan and midsize SUV. (Engine size under 3.5 liter) Universal valve connector for schrader valve is ready to use. Additional adapters include needles value (for basketball, balls), short cone/long cone adapters (for inflatable kayak, swimming pool accessories, etc)
Capacity: Does NOT Support truck tires, for instance: light truck tires (LT), heavy duty truck tires or any truck tires.
Easy to Read: 4 Display Units: PSI, KPA, BAR, KG/CM; LED FLASHLIGHT: Bright Torch
Prevent Over Inflation: Auto shut off when reaching the desired tire pressure. Overheat protection shuts off automatically when overloading. USPTO Patent NO:D875,788

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.5 out of 5 stars16,500 ratings4.5 out of 5 stars
